title: wizzair.com typeface
content:
Looking to identify the font used by Wizz Air (discount airline in Europe):  
 [http://wizzair.com/gallery/images/gal006\_038.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20071104014435/http:/wizzair.com/gallery/images/gal006_038.jpg "http://wizzair.com/gallery/images/gal006\_038.jpg")

The backwards-slant to the ends of the a, r and c and the pointy corners on the z should be a dead giveaway, but I’m coming up blank...

—Mike

 [‹ Armani font](http://web.archive.org/web/20071104014435/http:/www.typophile.com/node/10606 "Go to previous forum topic") [Jack Cole ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071104014435/http:/www.typophile.com/node/12075 "Go to next forum topic")
author: mnosal

comments.content: Looks pretty much like a customized Frutiger.

Looks like it to me.  
I thought it would be easy to find - but I couldn’t find all that many faces with the backwards-slanting ends on the a,r and c. I thought this would be a more common feature on sans-serif faces.

Thanks,  
—Mike
